Class ec.vatimpl.InvocationRunnable 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.meta.StdObj
           |
           +----ec.vatimpl.Inhabitant
                   |
                   +----ec.vatimpl.InvocationRunnable
public class InvocationRunnable
extends Inhabitant
implements Runnable
This a Runnable that is the embodiment of "target.method(args)" with an optional Result back-channel. It is the thing that gets queued up on the run queue in response to E message sends in general, and is also useful for things like the Timer class.

InvocationRunnable(Object, Method, Object[])
Create an InvocationRunnable for the given call (target.method (args)), but with no result back-channel.
InvocationRunnable(Object, Method, Object[], Result)
Create an InvocationRunnable for the given call (target.method (args)), with the given result for the back-channel.

InvocationRunnable 
 public InvocationRunnable(Object theTarget,
                           Method theMethod,
                           Object theArgs[],
                           Result theResult)
Create an InvocationRunnable for the given call (target.method (args)), with the given result for the back-channel.

Parameters:
theTarget - the target of the invocation
theMethod - the method to call
theArgs - the arguments to pass
theResult - the channel for the result. It may be null to ignore any resultant value or exception.
InvocationRunnable 
 public InvocationRunnable(Object theTarget,
                           Method theMethod,
                           Object theArgs[])
Create an InvocationRunnable for the given call (target.method (args)), but with no result back-channel. Any result is ignored.

Parameters:
theTarget - the target of the invocation
theMethod - the method to call
theArgs - the arguments to pass
